p: An improvement in aqueous solubility, antioxidant and other health-promoting properties, in vitro GI release profile, and protection against process and environment harsh conditions (e.g., light, oxygen, high temperatures, and humidity) of hydrophobic food bioactive compounds suitable as DISs could be achieved by nanoencapsulation using different nanoencapsulation DESs, including inclusion complexes of CDs, amylose, yeast cells, nanogels, NEs, nanofibers, nanosponges, nanoliposomes, and NPs made with lipids [ 149].
